questions.question: Who is responsible for the Cosmos (SOC)?
questions.answer: The governance for the Siemens Organizational Cosmos lies with GM TO.

questions.question: Who can answer my question concerning Organization Charts?
questions.answer: The respective OrgManager can answer all questions regarding the organizational structure, the functionality of SOC and they are responsible for OrgChanges too. You can find the list of OrgManager here.

questions.question: In the Org Charts / People Profile, why can't I find colleagues who work 'temporarily' at Siemens (e.g. external employees, apprentices or working students)?
questions.answer: Due to legal reasons, this community of co-workers are not shown in the Organization Charts, showing the management structure, or Legal Entity View. The additional person-groups (except external persons) can be found in the People Profile, e.g. via using the Advanced Search.

questions.question: Why can't I find any 'Workers Council' colleagues in the Org Charts?
questions.answer: The Workers Council is an independent body. As they do not report to any manager, they cannot be shown in the Management structures (Org Charts). However, also full-time members of the workers council have a people profile and can use the job tagging or any other function.

questions.question: Why can I only see eight people in the employee lists in the Org Charts? Where is the rest of the team?
questions.answer: Due to the large team sizes in Siemens globally, the Cosmos Org Charts show 8 employees at a time. First the Team Head and the team in alphabetical order. You can use the scroll bar located on the right edge of the team box, to scroll down to the rest of the employees.

questions.question: How can I change the background color of the Org Chart?
questions.answer:
You can choose between three different background themes in the Org Charts view. Click on the settings icon (the wheel) in the Org Chart toolbar, then choose your favourite theme and click 'save settings'.


This feature is available only in the Org Charts and Legal Entity View.

questions.question: I want to save or send a copy of an Org Chart, how can I do this?
questions.answer:
You can download the entire Org Chart area, beyond what you see on screen, by clicking on the download icon on the Cosmos toolbar.

This will create pdf version of the entire Organizational chart for you to save or send.

questions.question: What do the numbers mean below the Org Unit?
questions.answer:
The numbers shown reveal two types of role count (count of positions in the reporting chain). The left reveals the number of positions assigned to the unit above, the right the number of positions in the reporting chain, to the ultimate Head of the Unit shown on the top of your screen.


Please note a person can be counted twice if, for example, they are the head of two Org Units. However it is of course ensured that on Siemens level, each person is counted only once. These numbers are calculated based on the Siemens Management System and are updated daily. For further information please click here

questions.question: What is Job Tagging?
questions.answer:
Job Tagging is a way to show interest in a defined organizational unit and to receive an alert in case future vacancies come up.

As an employee you can document your interest and receive alerts in case new job ads are posted. You can decide to inform the manager of this organizational unit that you are interested in joining his/ her department.

As a manager you can approach interested employees who have shared their tags with you anytime to have a general exchange on motivation and qualification. Of course, employees can also approach you as a manager directly - Job Tagging does not substitute personal communication but supports it.

questions.question: How does Job Tagging work?
questions.answer:
Job Tagging functionality is hosted as beta feature on Siemens Organizational Cosmos (SOC).

  • You activate Job Tagging by turning on “Job Tagging” in the menu bar of the Organization Chart
  • You can leave a virtual tag with those departments you are interested in.
  • For each tag you set up you will get alerts in case new job ads are posted.
  • Additionally, you can choose to inform the manager of this organizational unit that you are interested in joining his/ her department and future opportunities.
  • As soon as a new job ad is published in the SOC, you will receive an alert.
  • In case you want to apply for this job you have to start the regular application process in the job respective internal market tool (Avature/ Taleo for US and Canada).
  • Tagging an OrgUnit does not mean that you are actually applying officially to any job.
  • You can find an overview on all your tags by clicking on the arrow next to your profile picture and then select "My Job Tags"

questions.question: Why is Job Tagging an experiment?
questions.answer:
Job Tagging is a new approach to take your career in your hands and own it.

We want to learn more about what employees and managers like and what they think could be improved when using this new functionality.

We encourage you to share your impressions or feedback with us.

questions.question: Who can set or remove Job tags?
questions.answer:
It is all about owning your career. The only one who can express interest is you. If a colleague or a manager thinks that a special organization might be the perfect place for your next step, he/ she can share this information informally with you. You decide whether you want to add or remove a tag.

If you are a manager and have doubts that an employee does not (yet) fit to your department you can of course approach this employee, learn more about him or her and provide feedback.

questions.question: Can my current manager see my tags?
questions.answer:
No. Your tags will not be visible to your current manager.

Depending on your decision, your tags are only visible to the manager in charge of the organization you are interested in.

You can define this individually for each of your tags - by activating or deactivating the checkbox 'Tag should be visible for the manager of this Org Unit'.

questions.question: Who can see which jobs I have tagged?
questions.answer:
This is up to you. If you want to you can make your interest visible to the manager of the organizational unit you are interested in. Just activate the checkbox 'Tag should be visible for the manager of this Org Unit'.

Otherwise you can keep your tag private, visible just for you. You will then only receive alerts in case new jobs are published for this unit.

Example: In case of a shared interest in HR PL PE only Dr. Michaela Schütt can see who is interested in working within her department either in a leading function or as a team member. Robert Neuhauser as Michaela's manager cannot see your tag.

questions.question: Why can't recruiters at Siemens see my tags?
questions.answer:
Neither recruiters nor other HR colleagues can see your tags. Job Tagging is a tool that should enable you to make yourself visible, to enhance your individual job opportunities and to build a network. We would like as many colleagues as possible to use this tool. Therefore, we have decided to make the tool as transparent and easy-to-use as possible. You have full control of your data, and if you want to keep your tags private, you can do so.

As a recruiter you can ask hiring managers in context of the placement activities if they have some tags for their department.

questions.question: What happens on the manager's side when I add a Job Tag?
questions.answer:
It depends on your choice: If you do not want to share your interest with the manager heading the organizational unit you are interested in, nothing happens. If you have decided to share your interest, the respective manager will be able to see your interest and -if you entered one - your comment.

Your current manager cannot see what you have tagged for and will of course not be notified if you define a new tag.

questions.question: What happens after I have tagged for an organizational unit?
questions.answer:
• In case a job ad is published for this unit, you will receive a notification with the link to the respective job ad. If this job fits your career plans, you can start the regular application process in the job market tool (Avature, Taleo for the US & Canada).
  • Please be aware that Job Tagging is currently in a "beta version" within the SOC and because of system interfaces those notifications for new jobs might be delayed.
  • If you have decided to share your interest with the manager of the respective organizational unit, this manager can see who has shown interest in his/ her organization, but it does not automatically trigger any further follow up processes.
  • You can set your preferences for each organizational unit tag individually.
  • Of course, you can also approach managers directly without using the Job Tagging functionality.

questions.question: What happens if an employee tags for my own role?
questions.answer: In the majority of cases this means that someone is interested in being your successor. You as a manager are involved in the succession planning for your unit including your own role, but responsibility for the final succession plan for your own role lies with your manager. Those who tagged your position can enrich the pipeline for your unit and thus provide support in finding a successor for you as a manager when you decide to take the next step. You should share interesting candidates with your own manager to discuss if this person should be added to the succession plan for your own position.

questions.question: What happens to my Job Tags if I have changed job?
questions.answer: There is no routine defined. You can decide if you want to keep your tags or delete them.

questions.question: What happens to my Job Tags if I leave the company?
questions.answer: If you leave the company, your tags will be deleted.

questions.question: What happens to my Job Tags in case of an organizational change affecting the unit I tagged?
questions.answer: You will receive a notification that a certain organizational code does not exist anymore. If you are interested in new organizational units you have to establish new tags.

questions.question: What is my commitment as an employee if I decide to share my tag with the manager heading this unit?
questions.answer:
When using the Job Tagging tool you express that you are interested in working for a specific organizational unit within a timeframe of the next two years.

If you just want to find out what jobs are out there, we recommend that you browse the SOC or the job market tool Avature (or in the US & Canada Taleo) for an instant impression or define alerts in these tools for more general future opportunities.

If you are interested in a lunch date, a mentorship or shadowing we recommend approaching the respective manager directly.

questions.question: Where should I leave my tag if I want to get a leadership role?
questions.answer:
Leave a tag with the unit in which you would like to take a leadership role. Select 'manager' and save

If you do not feel comfortable with the manager knowing that you are interested in a management role, you can opt out of sharing your interest and only go for the alerts.

questions.question: Why are alerts for new job ads not real time?
questions.answer: Currently alerts might be one day delayed because the interface between the job markets (Avature/ Taleo) and SOC being updated once a day and the batch input job starts in the night.

questions.question: Why can I not edit an existing tag?
questions.answer: You can prolong or delete a Job Tag, but not edit a tag content wise because the system is not designed to send updates on tags.

questions.question: Why can I only do one tag per organizational unit? Why can't I tag openly as team-member and anonymously for a leader function?
questions.answer:
The alerts you will receive are not linked to a specific vacancy, but to the entire selected organizational unit. Therefore one tag will keep you posted about all job ads in the organizational unit of your interest.

Unfortunately, there is no feature to distinguish open or private tags between team member and manager functions.

questions.question: Why do I get a notification for an employee role in case I have tagged for a manager's function only?
questions.answer: The Job Tag is also meant to specify for the unit's manager what level you are interested in. The alerts you will receive are not job specific but related to an organizational unit.

questions.question: Why do I have to apply additionally if I am interested in a published job?
questions.answer:
With your tag you show a generic, non-binding interest in the whole organizational unit and not in a concrete vacancy.

Moreover, at the time an interesting vacancy comes up it might not fit to your personal planning. Job Tagging helps you to enlarge your network and to make yourself more visible, but the actual recruitment happens via the internal job market tools (Avature or for the US & Canada Taleo).

questions.question: How is Job Tagging linked to the People Profile?
questions.answer:
In case you as an employee decide to share your interest/ your tag with the manager of the organizational unit you are interested in, this manager can directly open your People Profile from the overview of interested employees.

A well-maintained People Profile helps the manager to get a better idea of who you are and how you might contribute to the respective unit in the future.

questions.question: Will my tags expire some day?
questions.answer: A tag will expire after two years. In case you want to prolong it, click on 'renew'. This is possible at any point in time. by clicking on the 'Job Tag' icon in the menu under your profile picture in the header. Of course, you can delete a tag anytime you want to.

questions.question: An employee has shown interest in my organization via Job Tagging. What should I do now?
questions.answer:
Congratulations! Other people think that your organizational unit is a great place to work for.

Job Tagging is a way to show interest in an organizational unit. Employees who have tagged themselves for your unit will receive an alert in case job ads for this unit are published.

You as manager can use the tags to enlarge your network. You might want to find out more about this person and have a look at the respective People Profile.

If you want to, you can approach this person. Tell him/ her that you saw his/ her interest and offer to tell him or her more about your unit. You can directly access the employees contact data or start to write an e-mail from the overview in the "My Job Tags" section.

questions.question: As a manager, my team member told me/ in a succession discussion I noticed that my team member has tagged for another unit. Will he/ she leave?
questions.answer: Job Tagging shows that employees really own their careers. The time horizon for tagging is up to two year. Therefore adding a tag does not imply that your team-member will leave immediately, but that he/ she might want to move on in the future. Use your next continuous dialogue exchange to talk with your team-member about his/ her future plans.

questions.question: How can I as manager use the information that someone has tagged for my unit?
questions.answer:
Relationship is always a matter of trust: In case an employee tagged him-/ herself openly for your team, he/ she trusted that you will use this information appropriately and confidentially. Ensure you receive employee consent before e.g. contacting his/ her current manager.

So if you, for example, want to use this information for succession planning, it is best to talk about this with the tagging employee first, also find out when and for which concrete task(s) he/ she would be available.

questions.question: What should I do if no one tagged my organizational unit?
questions.answer: There is no need to worry. Remember you will only see these tags if an interested person has decided to share the tag with you.

questions.question: Is it necessary for me as a manager to talk to all persons who have documented interest in my department?
questions.answer:
• It’s up to you, if, when and how you approach employees interested in your department.
  • Keep in mind that Job Tagging is a new and good opportunity for managers to enlarge their network.
  • To get a better idea about persons interested in your department the easiest way is to talk to them directly.
  • Thus it is not mandatory, however direct exchange helps you to establish a relationship with promising candidates you want to win for your department.
  • In case you have the impression that an interested employee does not yet fit into your department it is also helpful to discuss openly with the respective employee what is still missing from a career perspective.

questions.question: Who is responsible for the People Profile View?
questions.answer: The overall governance for the People Profile View lies with GM TO. For certain data fields, other Organization Units, e.g. SCD responsible, HR are in charge.

questions.question: Who can view my People Profile?
questions.answer:
• Everyone at Siemens who has access to the SOC can see your profile including the information you have entered.
  • Unlike in the past, there are no special views for HR representatives or managers.
  • The information in your People Profile helps others to find you using the Advanced Search.
  • Manages who have received a Job Tag can also jump directly from Tagging to the employee’s People Profile.

questions.question: Who can edit my People Profile and what information is shared?
questions.answer:
Only you can add, edit or delete personal information in your People Profile.

Only information you added to your profile, either by an upload via LinkedIn or by editing data directly on the profile, will be visible within Siemens. You are the owner of your People Profile – and you decide what you want to share.

questions.question: How do I upload or change my profile photo?
questions.answer:
1. A click on your photo area takes you to your personal, photo-upload consent area. (Here you can read through the voluntary photo consent declaration. You can choose to change the language setting to English using the globe icon on the top right.)
  2. Use the button, to ‘select picture’ at the bottom of the pop up window to upload a new profile photo. (If you've already uploaded a photo then you will have the options to delete and upload a new photo to the Cosmos.).
  3. You will then have an opportunity to crop your photo, before you can ‘save’ your new or updated photo.
  4. Tick the boxes to select which applications you give your photo consent to and make sure the Siemens Organizational Cosmos (SOC) box is ticked!
  5. Finally, close the upload box when your are done and refresh your Cosmos browser to see your new photo uploaded!

questions.question: How can I add or change the function field in my profile?
questions.answer:
The function field in the Cosmos is sourced from your personal entry in the Siemens Corporate Directory (SCD). To change the function field in your Cosmos profile


  1. Go to the SCD
  2. Retrieve your own SCD profile
  3. Click 'change data' on the bottom left, below “Service links” - this will open up a new window (you will need to sign on with your PKI).
  4. If your Org Unit is using the Identity and Access Management to maintain SCD Data, then click on your personal entry
  5. Navigate to page 2 of the data fields (bottom left)
  6. Edit your SCD 'function' field
  7. Finally, save your changes before you leave the system.
  8. After a few days, your changes will be visible in the SOC.

Please note: The maintenance process of SCD data can vary by Org Unit. If you are experiencing issues with changing your function field please get in touch with your Unit's relevant SCD contact person.

questions.question: Which data fields of my People Profile can be updated in which way?

answer.data_field: Skills, Languages, Interests, Work Experience, Education, Accomplishments (Certificates, Courses, Honors & Awards, Patents), Headline, Summary
answer.contact: Data that has been manually entered in the SOC can be edited directly in your People Profile by clicking the edit pencil in the according data field. Data that has been imported from LinkedIn can only be updated in LinkedIn and needs to be imported again to SOC.

questions.question: Can I use my People Profile in context of applying for a job via Avature/ Taleo?
questions.answer:
There is no link for applying directly with your People Profile.

If your People Profile is well maintained and includes all information you would add to a traditional CV, then go to your own People Profile and click on “Export profile”. Save the pdf file for your next application.

questions.question: How does the call via Circuit function work?
questions.answer: Whenever you see a Circuit icon in the Cosmos next to a person you can click it to call this person directly via the Circuit App. Please note that you need the Circuit App installed on your computer or smartphone to use this function.

questions.question: How do I call colleagues directly from the Cosmos, using the SieDial App?
questions.answer:
SieDial helpfully allows you to click the phone number on a colleague's profile and will place a call to them directly from your work Smartphone.


In order to use this SieDial feature you must first download it via your work Smartphone, from the Siemens AppStore here.


After having installed SieDial you must run it once by clicking on it and then you are good to go. Need support setting this up? You can access the FAQs for the SieDial app here or contact your local IT Service.

questions.question: What is the 'headline' field below my picture for?
questions.answer: You can use this field to create your own short headline representing your personal motivation and giving a very short outline on who you are. It is like the flap text on the cover of a book. Describe what characterizes you in your professional environment. If you want to you can also add information about your ambitions for a next step.

questions.question: What is the field 'interests' for and how does it differ from 'skills'?
questions.answer: You can use the field 'interests' to share topics you are especially interested in and you want to learn more about. So 'interests' is more future-oriented. You can use the field 'skills' to share topics you are good at and you are using in your professional environment. So 'skills' refers to your expertise and proven knowledge.

questions.question: Why is it that some of the local time zones, in the USA, shown in the profile are off by an hour?
questions.answer: We appreciate all the great feedback that brought this to our attention. The development team is looking into this issue.

questions.question: Why should I invest time in my People Profile?
questions.answer:
• The People Profile is your internal resume and business card.
  • Share with colleagues within Siemens what you already have achieved, what you are good at and what you are interested in.
  • Get visible - use the chance to enlarge your network and to own your career.

questions.question: Who is responsible for the Legal Entity View?
questions.answer: The governance for the Legal Entity View lies with GM TO LAB.

questions.question: Where can I find the Siemens Company View or the Presentation of Siemens Legal Entities?
questions.answer: As with the Org Charts, the Siemens Legal Entities have also found a home in the Cosmos. See your colleagues organized by legal companies here and we hope you enjoy the benefits of the updated design and features.

questions.question: Who is responsible for the Siemens Governance View?
questions.answer: The governance for the Siemens Governance View lies with GM TO GOV.

questions.question: Who is responsible for the Portfolio View?
questions.answer: The governance for the Portfolio View lies with GM TO OD.

questions.question: What is the Collaboration and how does it work?
questions.answer:
With the Collaboration model agile teams have started to experiment with a scaling model that uses Squads, Chapters and Tribes who aim to implement ‘minimum viable bureaucracy’ and balance high autonomy with high alignment.

This Collaboration model serves as a blueprint for Siemens transformation processes and should enable and foster co-creation, organizational flexibility & fluidity, increased focus on expertise building, management with cross unit responsibility, agile working and autonomy of teams.

questions.question: What's an Alliance?
questions.answer: An Alliance is a group of Tribes with responsibility for top line metrics.

questions.question: What's a Tribe?
questions.answer: A Tribe is a collection of Squads with a Tribe Lead responsible for a team-of-teams realizing maximum value.

questions.question: What are Squads?
questions.answer:
Squads work on similar topics. They are responsible for one key area, such as maintenance, operations, production etc. The Squad members have end-to-end responsibility and the team has one long-term task at a time.

A Squad Lead has end-to-end responsibility for a service or a set of service and thus is the face to the service consumers; is a team member and does not have any line management responsibility; assumes functional management responsibility without being the formal functional manager.

questions.question: What's a Chapter?
questions.answer:
Each Squad has professionals specializing in certain areas. All these people, who have the same responsibilities in separate Squads, are gathered in a group called a Chapter.

A Chapter Lead is the line manager for the members of the Chapter where members have the same role/ function; is responsible for an area of expertise and its further development; does not have a say once it comes to content of services/ projects; defines knowledge levels and enforces methodologies and tools.

An Assigned Chapter is based in another Tribe and assigned for assisting purposes to a certain Tribe and its Squads.

questions.question: Can our department be part of the Collaboration?
questions.answer: If you want to contribute to the Collaboration please get in touch with the SOC Product Owner.
